urls.title: Register now! EFSA Scientific Colloquium 26 on risk-benefit assessment of combined exposure to nutrients and contaminants through food
urls.description: Risk-benefit assessment (RBA) of food poses significant scientific challenges given the need to weigh the nutritional and health benefits of food types against the potential health risks from hazards such as environmental contaminants present in food. EFSA invites experts in this field to take part in a scientific colloquium on RBA in February 2022. The discussions and key outcomes of the colloquium will help to inform an update of the EFSA Scientific Committee‚Äôs guidance on RBA, published in 2010. The guidance will inform a wide-ranging assessment of the health risks and health benefits of...

Dr Alfonso Siani @siani56: ‚ÄúPublic health importance should drive choice of nutrients, but decisionmakers may include them for other reasons eg to prioritise some foods even when science is not 100% clear an increase in their consumption is needed for public health reasons‚Äù

4/8
Given high prevalence of #overweight & #obesity in Europe decreasing #EnergyIntake is also of public health importance. But intakes of #dietaryfibre & #potassium are inadequate (& associated with long-term disease risks) so these should also be included

3/8 
What‚Äôs in the draft? 
Our nutritionists propose nutrients & non-nutrients to consider in #NutrientProfiling models based on public health importance eg intakes of #SaturatedFats, #sodium, added/free #sugars are currently excessive & associated with long-term disease risks.

2/8 What‚Äôs it about?The @EU_Commission aims to propose new legislation on harmonised #FoPlabelling by end 2022 as part of #FarmToForkStrategy https://t.co/ygbVbFtnML. Our scientific advice will inform #NutrientProfiling modelling for this purpose & for restricting claims @Food_EU
